name: Dugong Beach Lodge

reviews.text: I have only recently returned from Dugong Lodge. I had the privilege of going up with some of my colleagues for an incentive trip and followed this with my family joining me afterwards.
reviews.title: 5* Incentive Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can categorically say that this was one of the best venues we have ever been to. Nothing was too much trouble for the very helpful staff, the food was out of this world and the accommodation very comfortable.
reviews.title: Having travelled to over 50 countries, this is without doubt one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the family visit, we cannot wait to arrange a follow up visit. Thanks to Wayne, Marshall, Ashley and all your wonderful staff. The Haynes's
reviews.title: as close to paradise as we have been

reviews.text: A fantastic place from start to finish. Friendly attentive staff, relaxed, efficient management, amazing accomodation and the most beautiful quiet place you can imagine, all set in a conservation reserve with over 60 head of game - zebra, duiker etc no predators!!. After a hectic safari holiday we have previously visited Mauritius and Sun City for a few days to unwind and relax - not any more. From now on it'll be Dugong Beach every time. Perfect to simply unwind, do nothing, whilst being looked after royally by the great management and staff.
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty living in paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't let the generator issue put you off - it's really not a problem and there is electricity whenever you need it - I even watched most of the Ryder Cup!! The rest of the time we simply relaxed interspersed with a swin or a snorkel, dolphin watching, and the odd glass of wine!! If you want somewhere to simply get away from it all in luxury, put yourself in the hands of Wayne, Diane, Didi and the rest of the team and visit Dugong beach - perfect!!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have very recently visited Dugong Lodge, as part of our honeymoon. We stayed 5 nights.
reviews.title: Quiet and quirky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dugong Lodge is under relatively new management (it changed about 5 months ago) and has undergone some renovations, so is a much nicer place to stay that the other reviews had led me to believe.
reviews.title: If peace and quiet, and privacy is the name of the game...

likes.disliked: — service not excellent, yet not bad either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes the power comes from a generator, but in the rooms this is also backed up by battery powered lights. I'm glad the generator is turned off at night so it is completely quiet.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Disaster

likes.disliked: — The eggy bath, no electricity and rubbish

reviews.title: AWFUL
reviews.text: Yes the water is treated, the only place that the smell was noticeable was in the loo, and frankly I don't spend much time in there! The outside shower was lovely - the water is heated by solar panels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a five night stay at Dugong Beach Lodge. The pickup at Vilanculos airport was very efficient and the 45 minute boat trip was very good. Do be prepared for a 'wet' landing and wear appropriate clothes and shoes.
reviews.title: Bliss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What more can be said about the beautiful lodges, the very friendly staff, the most delicious food and the perfect surroundings? Dugong is on the mainland but felt like it was an island. In fact on a very high tide it is surrounded by water.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.text: This is a wonderful place to go and do absolutely nothing but relax.
reviews.title: Maldives on our doorstep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed an 8 night stay here, it was everything we had hoped for.The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished, the bed is large and comfortable, and there are 2 showers, inside and out, and a lovely bath. The deck area has tables and chairs, and each room has a lovely sea view,some have extra little cabanas nearer the water, lovely to watch the sunset.
reviews.title: Dream Honeymoon

reviews.text: We wanted a quiet peaceful break, and this is what we got.The food was simple and delicious,and the portions generous. All meals are taken on the main deck when the weather allows.
reviews.title: A beautiful spot

description: Located on 30 000 hectares of pristine Marine and Wildlife territory, it provides a unique Beach & Wilderness Experience in a hidden corner of sub-tropical Africa. This diverse eco-system of wilderness and wetland, with its powder white beaches and crystal clear water is host to a magnificent array of fish, dolphin and most importantly, the nearly extinct "Atlantic Dugong" (which resembles a sea lion). Shallow and deep water reefs reveal beautiful creatures such as the great leatherback turtles, sailfish and manta ray. Deep-sea fishing of marlin and barracuda is truly spectacular and the large flocks of flamingos and pelicans are a sight to behold.
